pain_points.description: Website navigation is cumbersome, requiring excessive backtracking.
supporting_quotes: I feel like I have to go back a lot more steps that way than with the app.
You have to go back to the top in order to go to the next month.
pain_points.frequency_severity: High - frequently mentioned and described as frustrating.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users have resorted to using the app exclusively for easier navigation.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Increases time spent finding information and may deter users from engaging with events.

pain_points.description: Lack of a search functionality on the website.
supporting_quotes: It would be easier if you could pick whatever committee that you think... and then go through and see what they have.
The app has a search bar, but the website doesn't.
pain_points.frequency_severity: High - mentioned multiple times with clear frustration.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may scroll through the calendar instead of searching.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Makes it difficult to quickly find relevant events, leading to potential missed opportunities.

pain_points.description: Confusion regarding event registration and availability.
supporting_quotes: I was going to sign up because you see it. And you have to remember to go back the next week and sign up.
Sometimes they have to, you can't sign up for another week or two.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Moderate - mentioned as a source of confusion, affecting user experience.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users look for event information in emails, but may miss sign-up periods.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Causes frustration and may lead to missing events or opportunities.

pain_points.description: Difficulty in finding signed-up events and confirming participation.
supporting_quotes: I actually haven't [figured that part out].
I look at my emails to see what I've signed up for.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Moderate - indicates a common concern but not as intense as others.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users check their emails instead of using the website.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Increases effort to manage event participation and may lead to confusion.

pain_points.description: Refund process is unclear and inefficient.
supporting_quotes: I never got a refund but it wasn't a big deal.
It should have just been processed.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Moderate - mentioned with concern about the lack of refunds.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may need to contact committee chairs directly for refunds.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Causes frustration and distrust in the registration process.

pain_points.description: Alumni contact information is not accessible.
supporting_quotes: I looked on the website to see if I could get it first.
How do they find each other after they're done?
pain_points.frequency_severity: Moderate - indicates a need for better alumni connectivity.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may reach out to others directly or rely on personal contacts.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Limits networking opportunities and connections with past members.

pain_points.description: Lack of clarity on committee roles and opportunities.
supporting_quotes: I don't know that there's any job description for board positions out there.
It would be easier to have a document that you could read.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Moderate - indicates a barrier to user engagement.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users have to ask around or dig through emails to find information.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Reduces willingness to get involved due to lack of information.

pain_points.description: Website does not archive past newsletters.
supporting_quotes: It's just in your email and if you wanted to go look at them, you'd have to go look at your old email.
I think that would be something helpful.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Low - mentioned as a potential improvement.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users search through their emails for old newsletters.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Increases effort in finding past information.
